result_equations.equation: vec S = (1/mu_0) (vec E times vec B)

explanation: The Poynting vector describes the directional energy flux density of electromagnetic fields, representing the rate of energy flow per unit area. It points in the direction of electromagnetic wave propagation and its magnitude gives the intensity. This vector is fundamental for understanding electromagnetic energy transport, radiation pressure, and power flow in electromagnetic systems.
assumptions: Maxwell's equations apply and the fields are well-defined.
The medium is non-magnetic (μ = μ₀) unless otherwise specified.
Maxwell's equations hold throughout the region of interest.
Energy conservation applies to the electromagnetic field.

derivation.description: Start with the electromagnetic energy conservation equation (Poynting theorem).
derivation.equation: partial u/partial t + nabla cdot vec S = -vec J cdot vec E

derivation.description: Define electromagnetic energy density in terms of electric and magnetic fields.
Calculate the time derivative of energy density using field derivatives.
derivation.equation: partial u/partial t = epsilon_0 vec E cdot partial vec E/partial t + (1/mu_0) vec B cdot partial vec B/partial t

derivation.description: Use Faraday's law and Ampère's law from Maxwell's equations.
derivation.equation: nabla times vec E = -partial vec B/partial t, nabla times vec B = mu_0 vec J + mu_0 epsilon_0 partial vec E/partial t

derivation.description: Substitute Maxwell's equations into the energy density time derivative.
derivation.equation: partial u/partial t = -epsilon_0 vec E cdot (nabla times vec E) + (1/mu_0) vec B cdot (nabla times vec B - mu_0 vec J)

derivation.description: Apply the vector identity for the divergence of a cross product.
derivation.equation: nabla cdot (vec E times vec B) = vec B cdot (nabla times vec E) - vec E cdot (nabla times vec B)

derivation.description: Rearrange to identify the energy flux term in the conservation equation.
derivation.equation: partial u/partial t + (1/mu_0) nabla cdot (vec E times vec B) = -vec J cdot vec E

derivation.description: Identify the Poynting vector as the electromagnetic energy flux density.
derivation.equation: vec S = (1/mu_0) (vec E times vec B)
